value.title: Enable identity protection in Microsoft 365
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure Active Directory (AD) Identity Protection and ways to optimize the end-user experience while benefiting security.

value.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

images.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub

value.title: Settle competing commits by using merge conflict resolution on GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn to settle overlapping commits across branches by using merge conflict resolution.

images.title: Settle competing commits by using merge conflict resolution on GitHub

value.title: Decompose a monolithic application into a microservices architecture
value.excerpt: Improve development agility, deployment, fault tolerance, and scalability by modernizing your application with a microservices architecture.

images.title: Decompose a monolithic application into a microservices architecture

value.title: Create and deploy a cloud-native ASP.NET Core microservice
value.excerpt: Create and deploy an ASP.NET Core microservice to AKS.

images.title: Create and deploy a cloud-native ASP.NET Core microservice

value.title: Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
value.excerpt: This module covers the basics of how to use the Cloud Adoption Frameworkâ€”a set of documentation, implementation guidance, best practices, and tools that aid in aligning the strategy for business, people, and technology.

images.title: Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure

value.title: Optimize your web applications by caching read-only data with Redis
value.excerpt: Use Redis caching in Azure to reduce the load on databases. Apply different caching architectures to support larger loads in distributed and high-volume environments.

images.title: Optimize your web applications by caching read-only data with Redis

value.title: Route system feedback to development teams
value.excerpt: Learn how continuous monitoring and dashboards give you insight into how customers use your software and where patterns of failure occur.

images.title: Route system feedback to development teams

value.title: Run parallel tasks in Azure Batch with the Azure CLI
value.excerpt: Azure Batch is an Azure service that enables you to run large-scale parallel and high-performance computing (HPC) applications efficiently in the cloud. There's no need to manage or configure infrastructure. Just schedule the job, allocate the resources you need, and let Batch take care of the rest.

images.title: Run parallel tasks in Azure Batch with the Azure CLI

value.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Set up automated testing in your pipeline to improve code quality.

images.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines

value.title: Run a background task in an App Service Web App with WebJobs
value.excerpt: Automate a task for a Web App that should run in the background without affecting the performance of the Web App.

images.title: Run a background task in an App Service Web App with WebJobs

value.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
value.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and helpful context.

images.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements

value.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results.

images.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics

value.title: Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture
value.excerpt: In this module, you will review the Azure infrastructure options for hosting SAP NetWeaver and S/4HANA systems in Azure. You will examine the differences between the offerings of traditional outsourcers and IaaS offerings.

images.title: Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture

value.title: Work with DataFrames columns in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Use the DataFrame Column Class Azure Databricks to apply column-level transformations, such as sorts, filters and aggregations.

images.title: Work with DataFrames columns in Azure Databricks

value.title: Automate tasks in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Scripting repetitive tasks in Azure SQL for regular maintenance jobs and multi-instance administration. Automation of error and resource alerts. Configuration of notifications for failures.

topItems.title: Configure automatic deployment for Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Utilize Azure Resource Manager templates for deploying Azure SQL resources.

topItems.title: Schedule tasks using SQL Server Agent
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for scheduled tasks and automatic alerts for SQL Server and Managed Instance. Configure extended event sessions for tracing activities.

topItems.title: Manage Azure PaaS resources using automated methods
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for Azure SQL Database and Open Source databases. Configure elastic jobs and Azure Policy.

value.title: Automate your deployments with Azure DevOps learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to combine automation techniques such as infrastructure as code with automated pipelines to provision and configure the infrastructure you need to run your applications and services.

topItems.title: Provision infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how infrastructure as code enables you to describe and automatically provision the infrastructure that you need for your application.

topItems.title: Configure infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run configuration management tools in Azure Pipelines to help keep your infrastructure configured as you need.

images.title: Configure infrastructure in Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Provision databases in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to automatically provision Azure SQL Database in Azure Pipelines by using an Azure Resource Manager template.

images.title: Provision databases in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions or about Azure IoT, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: Explain the essential characteristics of the IoT Edge and the functionality of the IoT Edge components (modules, runtime, and cloud interface). Characterize the types of problems that you can solve with IoT Edge.  Describe how the elements of IoT Edge can be combined to solve the problem of deploying IoT applications in the cloud.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

topItems.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: Deploy a pre-built temperature simulator module to the edge using a container. The pre-built module will be deployed to an IoT edge device. You will check that the module was successfully created and deployed to the edge. You will view the simulated data from the deployed module.

images.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device

topItems.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

images.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

value.title: Cloud storage
value.excerpt:
Gain a deep understanding of data and how it's stored on the cloud.
In this learning path, you will:

Get an overview of data and how it can be stored
Read case studies of how data is stored in distributed file systems
Learn from case studes of how NoSQL databases and cloud object storage works

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Cloud storage overview
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn all about data and get an overview of how it's stored, including local and distributed file systems, databases, and object storage.

topItems.title: Case studies: Distributed file systems
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover how distributed file systems work, then learn about Hadoop and Ceph.

topItems.title: Case studies: NoSQL databases and cloud object storage
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about two more types of storage - NoSQL databases and object storage - with case studies from industry.

images.title: Cloud storage overview

value.title: Get started with Machine Learning with an Azure Data Science Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: Azure includes a pre-configured virtual machine service for performing Data Science tasks. Learn how to use the Azure Data Science Virtual Machine to do common data analysis and machine learning tasks.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Azure Data Science Virtual Machine
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides some pre-configured virtual machine images specifically designed for data science.  Learn how you can use these to get a jump start on your data science work.

images.title: Introduction to the Azure Data Science Virtual Machine

topItems.title: Explore the types of Azure Data Science Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You learn about the types of Azure Data Science Virtual Machines (DSVM) and when to use each type.  You will learn about the Windows-based and Linux-based DSVMs which each support different needs.

images.title: Explore the types of Azure Data Science Virtual Machines

topItems.title: Provision and use an Azure Data Science Virtual Machine
topItems.excerpt: Provision and use an Azure Data Science Virtual Machine

images.title: Provision and use an Azure Data Science Virtual Machine
Introduction to the Azure Data Science Virtual Machine

value.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI in government
value.excerpt: It is imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in government. In this learning path, you will be provided with guidelines to assist in setting up principles and a governance model in your government organization. You will also be provided with resources, best practices, and tools.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, weâ€™ve recognized six principles that we believe should guide AI development and use â€” fairness, reliability and safety, privacy and security, inclusiveness, transparency, and accountability. For us, these principles are the cornerstone of a responsible and trustworthy approach to AI, especially as intelligent technology becomes more prevalent in the products and services we use every day. We recognize that every individual, company, and region will have their own beliefs and standards that should be reflected in their AI journey. We want to share our perspective as you consider developing your own guiding principles.

images.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

topItems.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI in government
topItems.excerpt: As AI becomes more prevalent, itâ€™s imperative that governments have practices in place to ensure that itâ€™s used responsibly. This starts with governments establishing their own guiding principles, then choosing and operationalizing a system of governance. We recognize that every government will have their own perspective on responsible AI, but weâ€™re hopeful that our perspective will serve as a helpful starting point as they embark on their own AI journey.

images.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI in government

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we have established our own governing practices for responsible AI. While every organization will have its own approach and we donâ€™t have all the answers, weâ€™d like to share what weâ€™ve learned so far.

images.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

For us, these principles are the cornerstone of a responsible and trustworthy approach to AI, especially as intelligent technology becomes more prevalent in the products and services we use every day. We recognize that every individual, company, and region will have their own beliefs and standards that should be reflected in their AI journey. We want to share our perspective as you consider developing your own guiding principles.

images.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

topItems.excerpt: As AI becomes more prevalent, itâ€™s imperative that organizations have governing practices in place to ensure that itâ€™s used responsibly. Responsible use of AI starts with organizations establishing their own guiding principles, then choosing and operationalizing a system of governance. We recognize that every organization will have their own perspective on responsible AI, but weâ€™re hopeful that our perspective will serve as a helpful starting point as others embark on their own AI journey.

images.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft

value.title: Implement knowledge mining with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Do you have information locked up in structured and unstructured data sources?  Using Azure Cognitive Search, you can extract key insights from this data, and enable applications to search and analyze them.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cognitive Search solution
topItems.excerpt: Unlock the hidden insights in your data with Azure Cognitive Search.

topItems.title: Create an enrichment pipeline with Azure Cognitive Search
topItems.excerpt: Use the power of artificial intelligence to enrich your data and find new insights.

topItems.title: Create a knowledge store with Azure Cognitive Search
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to persist the output from an Azure Cognitive Search enrichment pipeline for independent analysis or downstream processing.

value.excerpt: In this learning path, youâ€™ll learn about Azure IaaS networking and identity. After completing the learning path, youâ€™ll be able to implement IP addressing, manage DNS, and deploy and manage domain controllers in Azure.

value.title: Introduction to version control with Git
value.excerpt: Git is the leading version control tool and essential for developers. Learn how to leverage Git to track your own changes and collaborate with others.

topItems.title: Introduction to Git
topItems.excerpt: Find out what source control is, and get an introduction to Git - the world's most popular version control system.

images.title: Introduction to Git

topItems.title: Collaborate with Git
topItems.excerpt: Use Git to track changes to source code and collaborate with other developers

images.title: Collaborate with Git

topItems.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
topItems.excerpt: Level up your Git knowledge by learning about how to keep code separate using branches and how to merge them later

images.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
Introduction to Git

value.title: Manage cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Learn more about how the cloud works by exploring it's underlying technology of virtualization, how to take advantage of the cloud for scale, and how to automate cloud resource management.
In this learning path, you will:

Learn about virtualization and how it's used in the cloud
Know what VMs and containers are
Understand what scale, load, and common load patterns are
Know what autoscaling is and be familiar with autoscaling techniques
Learn how to automate cloud resource management with scripts
Understand the concept of infrastructure-as-code

In Partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity
topItems.excerpt: Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

images.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity

topItems.title: Automate cloud resource management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about how to automate cloud resource management with scripts and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.

images.title: Automate cloud resource management
